intro: Peucedanum runssoricum, commonly known as the Siberian cowparsley, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. It is native to the cold climates of Eastern Europe and Siberia, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm, with slender, hollow stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small white to pale yellow flowers appear in late spring, followed by small, dry fruits that are dispersed by wind. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been historically used in traditional herbal medicine for its potential health benefits.
